itemDescription: Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: George Thompson VC (23 October 1920 – 23 January 1945) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * George Thompson, recipient of the Victoria Cross
* Flight Sergeant George Thompson

* George Thompson (VC) whose posthumous Victoria Cross in 1945 is often cited as the best merited of the entire air war. He was the wireless operator in a Lancaster of No. 9 Squadron on a dawn raid against the Dortmund-Ems Canal when the plane was struck by a salvo of two 88 mm shells.
* George Thompson VC (1920–1945), Royal Air Force aviator

*George Thompson (footballer, born 1900) (1900–1968), goalkeeper for York City and Southampton in the 1920s
